session_info.name: WEZBA - Invited Oral Presentation, Accelerator Technology

papers.title: SRF Cavities Beyond Niobium: Challenges and Potential
authors: Cornell Laboratory for Accelerator-Based Sciences and Education

current preparation methods for niobium SRF cavities regularly achieve performance levels very close to the fundamental limitations of the material. Continued progress requires looking to alternative superconductors
but fabricating a high quality RF surface from these materials has proven uniquely challenging. In this talk
I will discuss the worldwide progress towards fabricating SRF cavity surfaces with alternative materials such as Nb3Sn
and MgB2. I will also discuss thin films and multilayer films of alternative materials

proposed as an alternative to bulk superconductors. I will present an improved theoretical understanding of the potential of such films. I will discuss new results and make suggestions for future directions beyond niobium.
